results.title: Washing machine [the cat]
results.brief_description: This humourous hand-drawn animation is in response to the theme washing machine. A meowing cat (Howard Tal van Kleef) is locked in the laundry as a disciplinary measure by its owner. The cat’s curiosity for the outside gets the better of him when a dog frightens him into a free-fall from the window ledge towards the operating washing machine. The cat has a near death experience, his important memories flash by as he falls.

results.title: Washing machine [caveman]
results.brief_description: A hand-drawn 2D computer animation in response to the theme washing machine. A caveman’s chase of a dinosaur is interrupted by his curiosity for a mysterious object in the landscape, a washing machine. He fiddles with and bashes the washing machine in an attempt to work out what it is and discovers its’ function, a ‘drinking fountain’ (pre-historic term unknown).

results.title: Washing feel good movie
results.brief_description: This film depicts cleanliness as a good idea by developing understanding of its benefits; particularly health reasons for personal and environmental cleanliness. Portrays children experiencing the pleasures of getting dirty and the pleasure of being clean.

results.title: Was it a vintage year?
results.brief_description: The Rutherglen Wine Festival in northern Victoria began in 1967 as a biennial event to complement the Barossa Vintage Festival - held every other year in South Australia. This film gives an impression of the second festival at Rutherglen in 1968.

results.title: Warwick Thornton: Mother Courage interview
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description:
In this interview, Warwick talks about his early days in Alice Springs and getting his start in radio before moving on to films. Warwick also discusses the reoccurring theme of the matriarch in his works and the freedom and joy he finds in installation art.

‘Mother Courage’ is a film and sculptural installation by the internationally acclaimed artist and filmmaker Warwick Thornton. Co-commissioned by ACMI and dOCUMENTA (13) as part of the ACMI Commissions Series, ‘Warwick Thornton: Mother Courage’ was a free exhibition in Gallery Two at ACMI 2013. As one of the most exciting filmmakers working in Australia today, Warwick Thornton is best known for ‘Samson & Delilah’, winner of the 2009 Camera d’Or at the Cannes Film Festival. His work, ‘Mother Courage’ (2012), is a dynamic, multi-screen art installation that features a dilapidated campervan as its centrepiece. Audiences will peer into the van’s grimy windows and through its rear doors, to view the provocative and poignant video contained within.

results.title: Spotlights: Warwick Thornton
results.brief_description: A Kaytetye man born and raised in Alice Springs. A film director, screenwriter and cinematographer, his debut feature film Samson and Delilah won the Caméra d’Or at the 2009 Cannes Film Festival. He also won the Asia Pacific Screen Award for Best Film in 2017 for Sweet Country.

constellations_primary.name: Warwick Thornton
constellations_primary.description: Brimming with Shakespearean undertones and pathos, Kaytetye filmmaker Warwick Thornton's debut feature Samson and Delilah is both a universal tale and one intrinsically tied to the experience of First Peoples in Central Australia.

results.description: Warwick Thornton is a Kaytetye man born and raised in Alice Springs. He also won the Asia Pacific Screen Award for Best Film in 2017 for Sweet Country.

results.title: Warty the toad
results.brief_description: In a whimsical twist of an old theme, Warty is vain about his ugliness and feels sorry for animals who are not as ugly. But when the butterfly, together with the turtle, grasshopper and frog save him from the hognose snake, Warty learns that there are things more important than how you look. For primary grades.

results.title: Wartime farming in the corn belt
results.brief_description: A World War II film showing American farmers using conservation methods to produce more food and to better utilise natural resources. Part of the ‘Food for Freedom’ program effort.
